Package BridgeBuilderAdv

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
BridgeBuilderAdv.GameBoard
Record Components:
char - [][] board (the shape of the board)
int - size (basic declaration of the size of the board)
public class GameBoard extends Object
This GameBoard Class below is the main code for the GameBoard side of the game
Author:
Adit Bhimani

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameBoard(int size)
    This GameBoard Class below is the main code for the GameBoard side of the game The size of the board gets initialized with a value given by the user All of the positions are initially set to "."

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(int size)
      This GameBoard Class below is the main code for the GameBoard side of the game The size of the board gets initialized with a value given by the user All of the positions are initially set to "."
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • placeToken

      public void placeToken(int boardRow, int boardCol, char token)
      This placeToken method places the specified token at the given row and column on the game board.
      Parameters:
      boardRow - the row index to place the token
      boardCol - the column index to place the token
      token - the token to be placed on the board

    • isPositionEmpty

      public boolean isPositionEmpty(int boardRow, int boardCol)
      This isPositionEmpty method checks if the specified position on the board is empty (contains '.').
      Parameters:
      boardRow - the row index to check
      boardCol - the column index to check
      Returns:
      true if the position is empty, false otherwise

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      This getSize method returns the size of the game board.
      Returns:
      the size of the game board

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Displays the current state of the game board. Prints the column headers and the contents of each cell.

    • checkForWinDirection

      public int checkForWinDirection(Player player)
      Checks if the specified player has won in any direction on the game board.
      Parameters:
      player - the player object whose token is checked for a win
      Returns:
      1 if the player has won horizontally, 3 if the player has won diagonally, 0 if no win

    • checkForTie

      public boolean checkForTie()
      Checks if the game board is in a tie state. A tie occurs when all positions on the board are filled.
      Returns:
      true if the game is tied, false otherwise
